title: Doran Shield. An item that needs to be addressed.
body:
> Stats 	
> +80 health
> +6 health regen per 5 seconds
> **Passive** 	
> Unique: Blocks 8 damage from single target attacks and spells from champions.

Doran's Shield. An early defensive version of the Doran's items. However, it absolutely fails in the defensive apartment. From other starting items like Flask, Cloth, or Ruby + pots, there is absolutely no reason to buy a Doran's Shield. Even on manaless champions. Flask + 3 pots gives you 810 effective in-lane health and 180 mana. Ruby + 2 gives you 450 health with a faster power spike of obtaining Sunfire for example. Cloth + 5 gives you 750 + 15 more armor and also allows you to power spike faster. Doran's Shield + 1? Measly 230 health with 1.2hp per sec. You might be saying to yourself "But the passive! It blocks 8 damage!" 

This is one of the biggest issues I want to bring up. The passive, blocking only single target attacks and spells, blocking 8 damage. That doesnt sound so bad right? Well considering the fact that it blocks 8 damage BEFORE resistances apply. Lets put it like this for example.

100 ad vs 100 armor
100 armor = 50% dmg reduction
50 damage is taken

VS

100 ad vs 100 armor + Doran's Shield passive
100 - 8 = 92
50% of 92 is 46
46 Damage is taken

Out of all of the Doran's items, Shield is the only one that loses it's value the longer the game goes. Or the more you gain armor to put it simply. Whereas Blade's 3% lifesteal can be stacked with other lifesteal items and can be used in conjunction with other AD items and Ring has a flat Mana Regen and it's passive, Shield fails in comparison. Also note that Shield also blocks only autos and targeted damage, meaning AOE damage like Pantheon's E gets a free ticket. 

So why has this item been ignored for so long? Note that this item didnt even block targeted spell damage for the longest item either. Shield has been a glorified noob trap item for over a year. So what needs to be fixed then? Simple. Have it block 8 damage AFTER resistances and maybe half of that from AOE attacks. Make it actually worth spending 440 gold. Otherwise, there's absolutely no reason to buy it. Not when there are other, better options around.

We've been thinking recently about doing a light overhaul on some defensive items (think a smaller version of the AP item changes coming in 5.13). Doran's Shield is one of the items we'd be looking at if so. A possible direction for that we've been considering is buffing the Unique Passive so it gains extra effectiveness against ranged auto attacks. That's very much at the idea stage though, rather than something we've committed to. One of the things we particularly want to avoid there, and so really need to test for, is the possibility of Doran's Shield becoming the dominant support buy again. When we've seen that in the past it's resulted in really narrow support picks (huge amount of Leona/Thresh, not much else) and that's something we don't want to reintroduce.

An idea I had to make Doran shield a bit restricted so its less attractive on supports is to maybe make a similar simple mechanic from Doran Rings or Blade.

Since Doran rings has a passive that grants mana on a unit that you killed, it ensures that only a solo laner that is allowed to last hit can use it.  Same goes for Doran's blade since its lifesteal so you have to keep AAing minions to heal up.

or you can make Dorans Shield build into Heart of the Mountain that way it can be an option for supports and top laners can go the opposite build route
Doran's items are designed to be very gold efficient without being slot efficient. Having it build into something defeats the purpose of the item.

Maybe have it build a tiny passive shield per minion killed that doesn't regenerate, you just 'gain x temporary HP when you kill a minion'  This allows you to build up damage mitigation when your opponent isn't nearby as well as forces your opponent to consider making trades often with you so the shield doesn't get big.

Maybe also have it shred the shield off when you go back to the fountain

On the other hand, you could have it give burst Shielding 'gain x shield that lasts for y seconds when you kill a minion'  Making playing a defensive character going in for a last hit not so easily punished.

You could always scale it back if needed.

Also I do hope you guys plan to give offensive AD items an overhaul similar to the AP one. Nearly as much as AP needed it AD could use more build variety, smoother build progression, some price adjustments, and more things that build out of Brutalizer (which only builds into one thing other than a jungle enchantment). Plus AP has TONS more good bruiser items than AD does.

If the idea is to make it better for laners but not really for supports, affecting the damage reduction seems like the wrong route, because no matter what it would be more (cost) efficient in a lane versus 2 opponents than versus 1 opponent, as it reduces damage for every attack, so it's reducing more damage overall.

In order to make it more efficient in a 1v1 lane, making it generate an actual shield seems like a better route.

Could use the Banshee's Veil of "after taking no damage from champions for x time" you generate a shield that blocks damage from champions but not minions (inner tower mechanic), which caps at x (low)% of your max health.

Since it's a shield that only generates when not taking damage from champions, it's less efficient versus 2 opponents (who can pop it and keep it down for longer, especially if you're a short range / melee support like Leona / Thresh / Amumu), and stronger versus 1 opponent (who has less opportunity to duel you).

My idea (all numbers are just examples no real suggestions)

+80 health
+4hp/5sec

Unique passiv: Gives a 40 points strong shield, that regenerates 20 shieldpoints/5secs, while not in combat for 4 seconds. 
While the shield is at full strength you gain + 4hp/5secs.


So basically if you are not in combat you gain 40 hp really fast and then regenrate hp a bit quicker. If you are in combat (and your shield is down) you gain almost nothing.

This could be called runic blessing ;)

Would be a bit complex for a dorans item though...

Idea behind this:

vs ranged... you would have an option to go in and take a lasthit without having to pop a pot, while the ranged dude maybe has to go into a more aggresive stance to keep you of your farm...

vs melee... you can try to always trade when your shield is up...

For supports that would mean melee supports could pretty much harass for free though.  Go in, smack the adc a bit, walk out for the shield to regen, repeat.

If you gained the regen or shield through minion kills, that might be different.

I think buffing the passive damage reduce will most likely end up with it becomeing popular on supports again.
If you want it to be a valid choice for toplaners, it would either have to offer some sustain supports don't have acces to(like a bit health for last hits ), or offer some manasustain(main reason to get flask/dorans ring over the shield on many champs), or offer some aditional damage vs minons to help with llasthitting/pushing.

Overall, the more agressive option not only give you similar power for trades/all ins, they also improve your farming and your kill potential especially together with a jungler. 
If the raw damage reduction/sustain is buffed enough to make it valid despite not adding kill potential, farming or mansustain, then it will very likely be a return of the tanky doran's shield support-meta.


p.s. flat damage reduction should also always be applyed after %reduction(resistances), just like flat pen is applyed after %pen, so flat reduction doesn't fall off as horrible a bit later in the game.
